topic.title: Using C++ Source Code
topic.p: Here are dependencies of the source code. Each box means a set of .h and .cpp file. For example, Vlpp means Vlpp.h and Vlpp.cpp.
Source code can be found in the Import folder.

topic.title: Vlpp, VlppOS, VlppRegex, VlppReflection, VlppParser
topic.p: These files are basic C++ constructions. GacUI is built on these libraries. In most of the cases, you only need functions and classes from Vlpp and VlppOs.

topic.title: VlppWorkflowLibrary
topic.p: This file contains a very thin library for generated C++ code from the Workflow script language. UI elements of GacUI are recommended to create from XML. All resource files will be compiled to the Workflow script language first, and then generate C++ code from these scripts. You need this file to run your UI.

topic.title: VlppWorkflowRuntime and VlppWorkflowCompiler
topic.p: Usually you don't need these files. VlppWorkflowRuntime contains virtual machine to run the Workflow script language directly. The runtime can serialize compiled script to a binary file and reload it. If some reflectable C++ classes are used in the script, please make sure all these classes are registered when loading it. VlppWorkflowCompiler contains a compiler for the Workflow script language.

topic.title: GacUI, GacUIWindows and DarkSkin
topic.p: This is the GacUI itself. GacUIWindows is the port to Windows OS. Windows older than 7 is not supported. DarkSkin is the default skin. If you have created your own skin for every control, you don't need this file.

topic.title: GacUIReflection and DarkSkinReflection
topic.p: Usually you don't need these files. These files registered all reflectable classes for GacUI. You only need this when you need to dynamically compiler and execute Workflow script that access GacUI classes.

Usually we don't need runtime reflection in this project, so you have to define a empty VCZH_DEBUG_NO_REFLECTION macro using in preprocessor definitions. You can either to this by updating your project properties, or use the /D compiler option if you are using Visual Studio Code.
When you don't need reflection, don't link these files, and you must add VCZH_DEBUG_NO_REFLECTION. You will save about 20 megabytes in the executable file.
When you need reflection, link these files, and you must not add VCZH_DEBUG_NO_REFLECTION.

topic.title: GacUICompiler
topic.p: Usually you don't need these files. This is the GacUI XML resource compiler. GacGen32.exe and GacGen64.exe are the executable version of this file.

topic.p: Please read the Demoes page for more information.
